alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Conecuh; Escambia; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 4:31PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Monroe, northeastern Clarke, northwestern Escambia, southwestern Wilcox and central Conecuh Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 431 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles south of Camden to 5 miles southwest of Castleberry. Movement was west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroeville, Thomasville, Evergreen, Camden, Frisco City, McCullough, Peterman, Uriah, Whatley, Pine Hill, Castleberry, Excel, Beatrice, Vredenburgh, Fulton, Repton, Yellow Bluff, I65 And US 84, I65 And CR 1 and I65 And AL 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
